item.title: Hello World
item.description: Hello World. This year I am moving my blog from Pelican to Hugo.

item.title: About
item.description: Who Am I? I’m a guy with passion for entrepreneurship and technology! Interesting Fact: I like to juggle. Education: B.S. in Computer Science from Purdue

item.title: Django Migrations Downgrade in Docker Swarm
item.description: Edge cases are a big problem in software engineering, one that I recently ran into while on a beta box was errors being thrown after a downgrade. First a little background on the application. It is a django application running in a docker container via docker-swarm. Our application upgrade/downgrade process is to reduce the amount of containers running down to 0. Change the tag numbers in our .yml file and then scale them back up.

item.title: Strategy for Moving Away From Legacy Code
item.description: 1) Chunk Your App Into Pieces Turn everything into a MICROservice. 2) Modernize Access To Data Implement Data Access via API’s or using a similar data store. Developers should not care what it looks like on the backend. They should be able to easly access and manipulate the data in a secure way using their favorite languages. 3) Replace Decaying Code Slowly replace chunks of your application one piece at a time.
